page.title: 13GAME KEEPING
page.content: Mr J Rideout, gamekeeper at Goodwood, is hoping to rear 10,000 pheasants this year. Earlier in the year he caught 600 birds for breeding. There are an estimated 82 acres of forest rich with pheasants. Every shooting season the average of 500 birds are shot, 158 of them are Mr Rideouts. The shooting season lasts from October 1st to January 31st. We visited Mr Rideout's hatchery and saw the incubators and watched the pheasant chicks as they hatched. We were invited to come in and hold them. They are released into the surrounding woods when they are six weeks old. The rich chalk deposits in the Downs supply crystals which are collected by Mr Rideout's son. By Jack.
